flawed_nl_solution:
If Isabella has $15 more than Giselle, she has $120+$15 = $138
Combined, Isabella and Giselle has $138+$120=$<<138+120=258>>258
Isabella has $45 more than Sam, meaning Sam has $138-$45=$93
Together, Sam, Isabella, and Giselle has $258+$93=$<<258+93=351>>351
if they donate the money to 3 shoppers at their local town's supermarket who then decides to share it equally, each shopper will receive $351/3=$<<351/3=117>>117
#### 117

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 135, not 138. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
